name: HiveMind Entity: "Strength In Numbers"
effect:
Gain the “Strength In Numbers” reaction.
HiveMind Entities are not self-aware enough to enter a Cascade state. They are also unable to take control of a mech as a protocol.
description: Dubbed the “Scarab Handshake”, this Hivemind Entity manifested shortly after the liberation of the Rubbleborn and the creation of the Scarab by KIE. Able to transform energy generated by the Scarab’s Bulwark Carapace into semi-solid compounds to mend a frame’s broken hull, the HME is also able to reconfigure its energy readings to act as a rudimentary form of quick cooling.

tags.name: AI
tags.description: A mech can only have one system with this tag installed at a time. Some AI systems grant the AI tag to the mech. A mech with the AI tag has an NHP or comp/con unit installed that can act onsomewhat autonomously. A pilot can choose to hand over the controls to their AI  or take control back as a protocol. Their mech gains its own set of actions and reactions when controlled by an AI, but the pilot can’t take actions or reactions with it until the start of their next turn. AIs can’t benefit from talents, and have a small chance of cascading when they take structure damage or stress damage.

actions.name: Strength in Numbers
actions.detail:
If the target has Overshield, you may activate one of the following effects:
- Bulk. Their Armor increases by 1 (up to a maximum of 4) until the end of their next turn or until you use this reaction again.
- Brilliance. They clear any amount of Heat up to an amount equal to their Overshield.
- Bravery. They clear one condition that wasn’t caused by their own systems, traits, talents, etc.
actions.trigger: You or a willing ally within HiveMind range ends their turn.

name: Hivemind Entity: "Colonial Stabilization"
effect:
Gain the “Colonial Stabilization” Reaction.
HiveMind Entities are not self-aware enough to enter a Cascade state. They are also unable to take control of a mech as a protocol.
description: HiveMind Entities given the “Colonial Stabilization” Command are able to quickly share and receive data from hurt squadmates, giving an incredibly detailed report of the damage to their companions in an effort to increase their survivability. Likewise, they are able to share these reports between automated repair subroutines to “sync”, allowing repair efforts to be improved upon thanks to the increase of available data processing power.

tags.name: AI
tags.description: A mech can only have one system with this tag installed at a time. Some AI systems grant the AI tag to the mech. A mech with the AI tag has an NHP or comp/con unit installed that can act onsomewhat autonomously. A pilot can choose to hand over the controls to their AI  or take control back as a protocol. Their mech gains its own set of actions and reactions when controlled by an AI, but the pilot can’t take actions or reactions with it until the start of their next turn. AIs can’t benefit from talents, and have a small chance of cascading when they take structure damage or stress damage.

actions.name: Colonial Stabilization
actions.detail:
Spend a charge, then apply one of the following effects:
  • A character of your choice adjacent to the triggering character or yourself may take 2 heat to Stabilize as a reaction
  • The triggering character may choose to take all secondary options when Stabilizing.
  • The triggering character may choose both of the primary options when Stabilizing.
actions.trigger: You or an allied character within Hivemind range takes the Stabilize Action.

name: Kheper's Amulet
description: Built around an exotic, crystallized form of a solid catalyst only found in the depths of the Rubble, the “Kheper’s Amulet” originally started as a good-luck charm in early Rubblefolk society. It would take decades before the crystal’s dormant energy-manipulation properties were first discovered. A specialized housing unit was later developed by the Bismuth Cadre, which allows the channeling of specific frequencies- amplified by a unique strain of BULWARK nano-cells- for offensive and defensive uses, typically by launching a charged swarm of nano-cells.

tags.name: Bolster
tags.description:
This system adds additional effects which enhance the Bolster action. Whenever you Bolster an allied character, you may also choose one of the Bolster options available to you and apply it to that character.
Credits to Kai Tave for the concept of this game mechanic.

actions.name: Sunrise
actions.detail: You gain 1d3 Overshield (or increase existing Overshield by that amount), then transfer any or all of your Overshield to the target

actions.name: Sunset
actions.detail: If the target is willing, it loses all Overshield, and a hostile character adjacent to them must make a System save. On a fail, that hostile character takes Explosive damage equal to the consumed Overshield (maximum 6) and is knocked back 2 spaces. On a Success, they only take half damage and are only knocked back 1 space.

name: COCOON-Class Energy Barrier
description: The most advanced piece of deployable cover native to the Rubblefolk, colloquially known as “Cocoon”, this nano-cell projector is able to create a thin, flexible barrier of force fields that reduces the velocity of projectiles and the radiation levels of plasma-based attacks that pass through it, even managing to segment itself to better cover the user and nearby allies.

actions.name: Activate COCOON-Class Energy Barrier
actions.detail:
When you activate this system, you create a Line 4 energy shield, 4 spaces high, in free spaces within line of sight and with at least 1 space adjacent to your mech.
Attacks that pass through the shield treat their target as having Soft Cover. If an attack deals any amount of energy, the target benefits from Hard Cover instead. While the shield is up, you become Slowed and gain the "Defensive Matrix" reaction. This barrier lasts until the end of your next turn.

actions.name: Defensive Matrix
actions.detail: Take 1 heat and reduce the damage dealt by the attack by 1d6. If this reduces the damage to 0 or lower, the target of the triggering attack gains 2 Overshield, or increases existent Overwhield by 2.
actions.trigger: An attack that passes through your COCOON-Class energy shield hits you or an ally adjacent to you.

name: Stallion Module
description: The Stallion module was originally developed by mining crew supervisors as a safety measure, allowing quick correction of errors and swift response to megafauna encounters.

tags.name: Bolster
tags.description:
This system adds additional effects which enhance the Bolster action. Whenever you Bolster an allied character, you may also choose one of the Bolster options available to you and apply it to that character.
Credits to Kai Tave for the concept of this game mechanic.

tags.name: UNIQUE
tags.description: This weapon or system cannot be duplicated – each character can only have one copy of it installed at a time.

actions.name: Ebony Unicorn
actions.detail:
The Target may Grapple, Ram or Lock on as a Reaction.
A character can only be affected by Ebony Unicorn 1/round.

actions.name: Ivory Pegasus
actions.detail:
The target may fly up to 4 spaces in any direction of their choosing as a Reaction but must end this movement on solid ground or start falling, unless they can Fly. This movement does not provoke reactions and ignores engagement.
A character can only be affected by Ivory Pegasus 1/round.

name: Voice of the Bishop
description: Hivespeakers don’t have favorites. Rather, they seek to help every colony member under their supervision to reach their full potential. Nothing more than encouraging words implanted within malleable code, “Voice of the Bishop” subroutines devote some of the processing restraints of the target towards the user, allowing the target to achieve peak efficiency for as long as the data transfer stays up.

tags.name: FULL TECH
tags.description: This tech can be used as a Full Tech Action

tags.name: UNIQUE
tags.description: This weapon or system cannot be duplicated – each character can only have one copy of it installed at a time.

actions.name: Knighthood
actions.detail:
Choose one allied character within sensors. Until the end of the scene, 1/round, they may Grapple or Ram as a free action.
There can only be 1 character under the effects of Knighthood at any given scene, if a second character benefits from this effect, it ceases on the previous one.

actions.name: Priesthood
actions.detail:
Choose one allied character within sensors and line of sight. Until the end of the scene, 1/round, they may Lock On or Bolster as a free action.
There can only be 1 character under the effects of Priesthood at any given scene, if a second character benefits from this effect, it ceases on the previous one.

name: White Tower’s Barrier
description:
Despite its intangibility, the hivemind is still a system that requires constant maintenance and upkeep. Hive Speakers shared the methods used to keep the Hivemind within efficient standards to the KIE engineers, which quickly began to modify it in an effort to develop a more efficient damage response reinforcement unit.
Upon presenting this new response system to the Hive Speakers, it took them approximately 54 minutes to develop their own version, the “White Tower Barrier”, turning the presented version obsolete.

tags.name: QUICK TECH
tags.description: This tech can be used as a Quick Tech Action

tags.name: UNIQUE
tags.description: This weapon or system cannot be duplicated – each character can only have one copy of it installed at a time.

actions.name: Activate White Tower's Barrier
actions.detail: Choose one adjacent allied character to cover them with a faint digital barrier until adjacency is broken. While the barrier is up, you gain the Divine Intervention reaction.

actions.name: Divine Intervention
actions.detail: You may Bolster the triggering character or apply Lock On to the attacker. This reaction resolves before the triggering effect.
actions.trigger: A character covered by your White Tower Barrier is forced to make a save or check by an enemy.

name: HiveMind Entity: Incantations of the Underking
effect:
Gain the “Favored by Fate” reaction.
HiveMind Entities are not self-aware enough to enter a Cascade state. They are also unable to take control of a mech as a protocol.
description: The Underking was known for its might, stoicism and unquestionable decrees. Yet its followers still remember the way it could cultivate and augment the inner potential of everyone who heard its words of ancient wisdom. This HiveMind Entity is formed from these memories, an ancestral codex of information and instincts.

tags.name: AI
tags.description: A mech can only have one system with this tag installed at a time. Some AI systems grant the AI tag to the mech. A mech with the AI tag has an NHP or comp/con unit installed that can act onsomewhat autonomously. A pilot can choose to hand over the controls to their AI  or take control back as a protocol. Their mech gains its own set of actions and reactions when controlled by an AI, but the pilot can’t take actions or reactions with it until the start of their next turn. AIs can’t benefit from talents, and have a small chance of cascading when they take structure damage or stress damage.

actions.name: Favored by Fate
actions.detail: If they are under the effect of the Bolster tech action, they may consume the Bolster to roll the d20 twice and choose either result. Each character may only benefit from this reaction 1/scene.
actions.trigger: An allied character makes an attack, check or save.

name: Master Strategist Subcommands
description: The Master Strategist Subcommands are a compact version of more sophisticated Hivemind Commands, only able to be installed with a rigorous network improvement of the main user. This advanced code is unstable but capable of pushing a mech beyond its usual limits under the right circumstances.

tags.name: Bolster
tags.description:
This system adds additional effects which enhance the Bolster action. Whenever you Bolster an allied character, you may also choose one of the Bolster options available to you and apply it to that character.
Credits to Kai Tave for the concept of this game mechanic.

actions.name: Gambit
actions.detail: The target may immediately Skirmish once against each character of its choice within range 3 of them, dealing half damage, heat and burn on hit as a reaction. The chosen allied character is then Dazed until the end of their next turn.

actions.name: Check-Mate
actions.detail: Choose one hostile character within range 3 of the target and yourself. The chosen hostile character must succeed on a System save or be Shredded and Jammed. If they succeed, they instead may clear up to two conditions of their choice. A character can be Shredded and Jammed by this action only 1/Scene.

name: Flickering Flames
description: Part of the standard modification of the “Forge Bearers”, the Pilot Flame Flickering Syphon (or Flickering Flames for short), makes use of advanced thermal insulation projectors that quite literally manipulate most flames as if they were clay under a frame’s hands.

tags.name: QUICK TECH
tags.description: This tech can be used as a Quick Tech Action

tags.name: UNIQUE
tags.description: This weapon or system cannot be duplicated – each character can only have one copy of it installed at a time.

actions.name: Burn To Cinders
actions.detail: Select a character within Sensors with any amount of Burn marked. They clear 1d6 Burn and you take the same amount of Burn. The target then takes AP energy damage equal to the Burn cleared.

actions.name: Thermal Appetite
actions.detail: You link your reactor to feed from the heat generated by an allied character within Sensors. This link lasts until either character becomes Jammed, Overheats or you dismiss it as a free action. When the target takes heat from its own systems while the link is active, you may reduce the heat they take by 1 and take 1 heat yourself. You may have only 1 active link at a time.

name: TYPE-9 Chrysalis Charges
effect: Spend a charge for one of the following effects:
description: The Chrysalis charges were originally developed as backup batteries to store the excess energy generated by the shield projectors of Hive Protectors. With some modifications, these became able to release the energy stored within as a pulse of energy that immediately coats all nearby surfaces as an extra layer of protection.

tags.name: GRENADE
tags.description: As a quick action, this explosive or other device can be thrown to a space within line of sight and the specified Range.

tags.name: MINE
tags.description: As a quick action, this device can be planted in an adjacent, free and valid space on any surface, but not adjacent to any other mines. Upon deployment, it arms at the end of the deploying character’s turn and – unless otherwise specified – is triggered when any character enters an adjacent space. Characters leaving an adjacent space will not trigger a mine. Once triggered, a mine creates a Burst attack starting from the space in which it was placed. Mines within a character’s Sensors can be detected by making a successful Systems check as a quick action, otherwise they are Hidden and can’t be targeted. Detected mines can be disarmed from adjacent spaces by making a successful Systems check as a quick action; the attempt takes place before the mine detonates, and on a failure, the mine detonates as normal.

tags.name: UNIQUE
tags.description: This weapon or system cannot be duplicated – each character can only have one copy of it installed at a time.

actions.name: Chrysalis Grenade
actions.detail: All Characters within the affected area gain 2 Overshield.

deployables.name: Chrysalis Investiture
deployables.detail: When an allied character moves over or adjacent to this mine, you can cause it to burst and surround them with a protective energy field as a reaction. The target gains 5 Overshield and benefits from Soft Cover while this Overshield lasts.

name: "Antlion" Charges
effect: Expend a charge for one of the following effects:
description: Employing industrial-grade tethering lines linked to a strong miniature engine, the Antlion charges can be quickly deployed and triggered to subdue a wide range of threats found in Jovo, from megafauna to rogue bandits piloting large mechs.

tags.name: GRENADE
tags.description: As a quick action, this explosive or other device can be thrown to a space within line of sight and the specified Range.

tags.name: MINE
tags.description: As a quick action, this device can be planted in an adjacent, free and valid space on any surface, but not adjacent to any other mines. Upon deployment, it arms at the end of the deploying character’s turn and – unless otherwise specified – is triggered when any character enters an adjacent space. Characters leaving an adjacent space will not trigger a mine. Once triggered, a mine creates a Burst attack starting from the space in which it was placed. Mines within a character’s Sensors can be detected by making a successful Systems check as a quick action, otherwise they are Hidden and can’t be targeted. Detected mines can be disarmed from adjacent spaces by making a successful Systems check as a quick action; the attempt takes place before the mine detonates, and on a failure, the mine detonates as normal.

tags.name: UNIQUE
tags.description: This weapon or system cannot be duplicated – each character can only have one copy of it installed at a time.

actions.name: "Antlion" Grenade
actions.detail: Characters in the blast area must succeed on an AGILITY Save or be pulled adjacent, or as close as possible, to the center of the blast.

deployables.name: "Antilion" Mine
deployables.detail:
After arming, the next hostile character to move adjacent to the mine must succeed on an AGILITY Save or become GRAPPLED by the mine, which counts as a size 3 character when grappling. This Mine can be activated as a Quick Action after it is armed. When it does so, it may move up to 3 spaces towards a hostile character and detonates if it ends this movement adjacent to an hostile character. You then take 1 Heat. Only one Antlion mine can be manually activated on your turn. The Antlion Mine uses your Hull or Agility for the purposes of making contested Checks to maintain control of the grapple.
While at least one Antlion Charge is grappling a character, you take 1 Heat at the end of each of your turns.
When this system Grapples a hostile character, they count as being Grappled by you for the purposes of traits, talents, or systems.

actions.name: "Antlion" Mine manual Detonation
actions.detail: Manually detonate your "Antlion" mine, moving them 3 spaces towards an hostile character before detonating if adjacent to them.

name: "Snapjaw" Drone
effect: You may deploy or redeploy this Drone as a Quick Action to any free space within HiveMind Range.
description: Strength in numbers is common Rubblefolk philosophy, and no worker knows this better than the miners of Jovo. The Snapjaw Drone is part of the many methods used by the Rubblefolk to keep local megafauna at bay. Capable of limited self-piloting, the Snapjaw drone applies incredible force with its smaller scale Cargo clamps to subdue aggressive attackers, holding them down until dispatched or taken down. Outside of the Rubble, the JXC has ordered Snapjaw Drones in limited quantities for both defense and utility duties, using them to carry heavy loads. Small settlements such as Oasis have also purchased several models for similar usages, seeing them as safer alternatives to powersuits for transporting hazardous materials.

tags.name: HIVEMIND
tags.description:
HiveMind: HiveMind systems utilize a local sensor network to provide increased efficiency and coordination. You can link to an Allied character, allowing you to use their sensors as your own when using a Hivemind system, as long as they are within your sensors, or if you are within their sensors. This can Chain without limit, meaning you can continue to extend your Hivemind range, as long as there are valid allied characters within range to do so.

You become unable to link Hivemind range while you are Jammed, or if the linked allied character is Jammed.

tags.name: DRONE
tags.description: This is a self-propelled, semi-autonomous unit with rudimentary intelligence. Unless otherwise specified, Drones are Size 1/2 characters that are allied to the user and have 10 Evasion, 5 HP, and 0 Armor. To be used they must be deployed to a free, valid space within Sensors and line of sight, typically as a quick action. Once deployed, they can be recalled with the same action used to deploy them (quick action or full action, etc.), rejoining with your mech. By default, Drones can’t take actions or move; if they do have actions or movement, they act on their user’s turn. They benefit from cover and other defenses as usual, and make all mech skill checks and saves at +0. If a Drone reaches 0 HP, it is destroyed and must be repaired before it can be used again – like any system. As long as a Drone  hasn’t been destroyed, it is restored to full HP when the user rests or performs a Full Repair. Deployed Drones  persist for the rest of the scene, until destroyed, or until otherwise specified.

deployables.name: Snapjaw Drone
deployables.detail:
The Snapjaw Drone may move independently on your turn. When a hostile character starts their turn within Range 3 of the Snapjaw Drone, the Drone moves adjacent to them and forces the target to make an Agility Save or else become Grappled by the Drone. While Grappled by the Snapjaw Drone, the target takes 3 AP Kinetic Damage at the start of each of their turns. You can order the Snapjaw Drone to let go of a target as a free action.
The Snapjaw Drone counts as Size 2 for the sake of Grappling. The Snapjaw cannot grapple more than one character at a time, but may give up its current target for a new one if it would be triggered. The Snapjaw Drone uses your Hull or Agility for the purposes of making contested Checks to maintain control of the Grapple.

actions.name: Move Command
actions.detail: The Trapjaw drone moves up to its speed in a direction of your choice.

name: HiveMind Entity: “Nest Sentinel”
effect:
When you or an allied character within HiveMind range hits a character with a melee attack, allied characters within HiveMind range of the attacker (Including yourself, if you were not the Attacker) may use a reaction to Boost directly towards the target. 
This effect can be triggered any number of times on a turn or round, but each character can only use this reaction to Boost 1/round.
HiveMind Entities are not self-aware enough to enter a Cascade state. They are also unable to take control of a mech as a protocol.
description: This HiveMind program is designed to counter surprise intrusions by local fauna via high-speed synchronization of their sensor feeds, but works equally well against Mechs.

tags.name: AI
tags.description: A mech can only have one system with this tag installed at a time. Some AI systems grant the AI tag to the mech. A mech with the AI tag has an NHP or comp/con unit installed that can act onsomewhat autonomously. A pilot can choose to hand over the controls to their AI  or take control back as a protocol. Their mech gains its own set of actions and reactions when controlled by an AI, but the pilot can’t take actions or reactions with it until the start of their next turn. AIs can’t benefit from talents, and have a small chance of cascading when they take structure damage or stress damage.

name: TREMOR MINING PAYLOAD
effect: 1/Round, when you destroy a terrain piece, object or deployable, you can expend one charge of this system to create a Burst 1 zone of exploding debris centered on the destroyed object. Characters within the affected area must pass an Agility save or take 1d6+2 Explosive damage, taking half damage on a pass.
description: Favored by demolitionists, Tremor Mining Payloads are a specialized set of submunitions used to maximize the force released by shaped explosives. Rarely used in combat, most “Hive Wreckers”- such as the infamously “boom-happy” Protector Cadre Feldspar- employ these charges to bust plasma-wing nests wide open for extermination, and are known to use them in a similar manner with other invasive megafauna.

name: HiveMind Entity: “Optimized Targeting”
effect:
Ranged weapons of Yourself and Allied characters within HiveMind Range have their Range by +3 Range, if they possess any Range.
Melee and CQB weapons of Allied characters within HiveMind Range have their Threat increased by +1, if they possess Threat.
HiveMind Entities are not self-aware enough to enter a Cascade state. They are also unable to take control of a mech as a protocol.
description: Making use of advanced triangulation metrics thanks to the synchronized data feeds from nearby HiveMind users, the “Optimized Targeting” configuration allows weapons to be used beyond their standard range without any hardware modifications.

tags.name: AI
tags.description: A mech can only have one system with this tag installed at a time. Some AI systems grant the AI tag to the mech. A mech with the AI tag has an NHP or comp/con unit installed that can act onsomewhat autonomously. A pilot can choose to hand over the controls to their AI  or take control back as a protocol. Their mech gains its own set of actions and reactions when controlled by an AI, but the pilot can’t take actions or reactions with it until the start of their next turn. AIs can’t benefit from talents, and have a small chance of cascading when they take structure damage or stress damage.

name: HiveMind Entity: “Hazard Control"
effect: When you or an allied character within Hivemind Range makes an Engineering check to clear Burn at the end of their turn, they may roll twice and choose either result. Additionally, gain the “Hazard Control” Reaction.
description: KIE engineers quickly learned what internal components of a frame are the most susceptible to puncture-caused immolation after being forced to repair overzealous Fireflies. They documented their findings and uploaded them as an extensive data pack for militarized frames to use, being able to exploit these engineering weak spots within hostile targets or preemptively compensate for their failings as needed. The resulting HiveMind Entity- designated “Hazard Control”- has found use in both KIE mechs and in maintaining safe living parameters for Rubbleborn colonies across the Tsarina system.

tags.name: AI
tags.description: A mech can only have one system with this tag installed at a time. Some AI systems grant the AI tag to the mech. A mech with the AI tag has an NHP or comp/con unit installed that can act onsomewhat autonomously. A pilot can choose to hand over the controls to their AI  or take control back as a protocol. Their mech gains its own set of actions and reactions when controlled by an AI, but the pilot can’t take actions or reactions with it until the start of their next turn. AIs can’t benefit from talents, and have a small chance of cascading when they take structure damage or stress damage.

actions.name: Hazard Control
actions.detail:
Apply an additional effect based on the result of their roll:
  • 0 or Less: The target takes 1d6 Burn, and becomes Impaired and Slowed until the end of their next turn.
  • 1-9: The target becomes Slowed and Impaired until the end of their next turn.
  • 10-19: The target may Boost as a reaction. This movement ignores reactions and engagement.
  • 20+: The target gains 3 Overshield and may Boost as a reaction. This movement ignores reactions and engagement.
actions.trigger: You or another character within Hivemind range has rolled an Engineering check to clear burn at the end of their turn.

name: Miner's Handshake
effect: Characters Grappled by you suffer +2 Difficulty on all attacks made against characters other than yourself.
description: "There's a reason as to why Miners always salute and never shake hands" - Prospector Isaac, JXC crew member.

name: Spare Parts Storage
description: “Oh, you know… figured I’d just pack some extra plating, nano-gel, maybe some duct tape too. Never hurts.” - Tyze Kyre, Rubblefolk Salvager and Field Mechanic

actions.name: Spare Parts
actions.detail:
When you activate this system, select either yourself or an adjacent willing character. This system is destroyed, and you can cause one of the following effects on the chosen character:
- The target clears 1 condition not caused by their own systems, traits, etc.
- The target regains up to 2 charges of one Limited system or weapon.
- The target repairs all destroyed weapons on a single mount or a single system
- The target regains HP equal to half their maximum HP.
- The target clears Exposed and Heat up to an amount equal to half their Heat Cap. 
This system can only be used once before each Full Repair, and is not a valid target for system destruction.

name: Force Homeostasis
description: As part of the biomechanical elements of Rubbleborn technology, the nanite-based cells and organs that make up their mechs are capable of maintaining a level of homeostasis akin to a biological organism. Like the organisms they copy, trauma and other ailments can knock this homeostasis out of alignment, but technological systems are able to correct this given enough time. Knowledge of these biomechanic systems can be translated to most frames with some minor modifications.

tags.name: Bolster
tags.description:
This system adds additional effects which enhance the Bolster action. Whenever you Bolster an allied character, you may also choose one of the Bolster options available to you and apply it to that character.
Credits to Kai Tave for the concept of this game mechanic.

actions.name: Shape Up
actions.detail: The target may choose any condition currently affecting them, as long as they weren’t caused by their own systems, traits, talents, etc. They make an Engineering check for each selected condition in any order of their choice, clearing the condition on a success. After all Engineering checks have been rolled, the target takes Heat equal to 1 + the number of conditions successfully cleared by this Bolster option.

actions.name: Settle Down
actions.detail: The target clears any amount of heat, up to 4, and becomes Slowed until the end of their next turn.

name: “Phoenix” Thermal Veil
description: The Firefly's prototype- the Incandis, or “Glowfly”- was notorious for its "leaking" reactor due to a fault in the shielding plates. The Firefly weaponizes this tendency to create a sight and trajectory disruption field that fully wreathes the user, but the modification can be put on any frame with the proper tools.

tags.name: UNIQUE
tags.description: This weapon or system cannot be duplicated – each character can only have one copy of it installed at a time.

actions.name: Immortal Wings
actions.detail: Expend a charge to gain resistance to Energy damage, Heat and Burn dealt by the attack. Additionally, the attacker must succeed on an Engineering save or take 2 Heat and 2 Burn.
actions.trigger: You take damage from a melee attack.

name: Companion Drone I
description: Gained from the Wrangler: Rank I pilot talent.

deployables.name: Companion Drone
deployables.detail: This Drone has enough space to fit a single AUX weapon available to you, which you choose when deploying the drone. The weapon’s threat, cone, burst, line, blast and range is reduced to 3, unless already lower, if the weapon has the Unique property it can only be installed in either your mech or a Companion drone, not both, and any SP cost is subtracted from your mech’s SP limit (NOTE: This feature is unsupported by Comp/Con, instead you can write the weapons in the notes section of the Drone, creating custom counters for their limited uses, and accounting for SP accordingly). This weapon cannot be modified and doesn't benefit from your talents, traits or core bonuses.

actions.name: Companion Drone Command
actions.detail: You order the Companion Drone to move up to its speed in a direction of your choosing.

actions.name: Companion Drone Attack Order
actions.detail: You order your Companion Drone to attack your target with its weapons.
actions.trigger: You score a critical hit against a target within the drone weapon’s range

name: Companion Drone II
description: Gained from the Wrangler: Rank II pilot talent.

deployables.name: Companion Drone II
deployables.detail:
This Drone has enough space to fit a single AUX weapon available to you, which you choose when deploying the drone. The weapon’s threat, cone, burst, line, blast and range is reduced to 3, unless already lower, if the weapon has the Unique property it can only be installed in either your mech or a Companion drone, not both, and any SP cost is subtracted from your mech’s SP limit (NOTE: This feature is unsupported by Comp/Con, instead you can write the weapons in the notes section of the Drone, creating custom counters for their limited uses, and accounting for SP accordingly). This weapon cannot be modified and doesn't benefit from your talents, traits or core bonuses.
Additionally, when you deploy this drone, choose one of the following Configurations to grant a unique bonus to your Companion Drone: Assault, Stealth, Recon or Maintenance.
  • Assault: The drone’s mount is upgraded to a FLEX mount.
  • Stealth: The drone is permanently Invisible, and is able to Hide after it moves.

name: Companion Drone III
description: Gained from the Wrangler: Rank III pilot talent.

deployables.name: Companion Drone III
deployables.detail:
This Drone has enough space to fit a single AUX weapon available to you, which you choose when deploying the drone. The weapon’s threat, cone, burst, line, blast and range is reduced to 3, unless already lower, if the weapon has the Unique property it can only be installed in either your mech or a Companion drone, not both, and any SP cost is subtracted from your mech’s SP limit (NOTE: This feature is unsupported by Comp/Con, instead you can write the weapons in the notes section of the Drone, creating custom counters for their limited uses, and accounting for SP accordingly). This weapon cannot be modified and doesn't benefit from your talents, traits or core bonuses.
Additionally, when you deploy this drone, choose one of the following Configurations to grant a unique bonus to your Companion Drone: Assault, Stealth, Recon or Maintenance.
  • Assault: The drone’s mount is upgraded to a FLEX mount.
  • Stealth: The drone is permanently Invisible, and is able to Hide after it moves.
  • Recon: The drone gains a sensor range of 5, and you may order it to Scan instead of moving
  • Maintenance: At the end of your turn, a character adjacent to the drone of your choice may clear 1 Heat or gain 2 Overshield.
Lastly, 1/mission, you can deploy two Companion drones instead of one. Each of these drones can use a different configuration and set of weapons. You can give the same or different orders to each one of these drones, and the limit of the reaction attack increases to 2/round, one for each drone.

tags.name: Keen

When you make an attack with a Keen weapon, lower the threshold required to score a critical hit by an amount equal to its Keen value. name: Ambrosia Garden Portable Habitat
description: Located below even the Cloning Gardens that make up the Rubble’s main source of biomass, the Ambrosia Farms are sprawling cave systems where nano-cell and jovocytes are harvested by Hiveworker farmers for use in a large variety of fuels, polymers, oils, and fibers. While the Rubblefolk term for both roughly translates to “Food/Fuel/Cells of Life”, an early error with the translation software used by the USB at Camp Fireside resulted in both being designated as “Ambrosia”. The Jovocyte component of Ambrosia is a robust, extremophile strain seemingly domesticated by the mysterious first colonists of Jovo, lacking many of the directly-harmful heavy metals that other Jovocyte species possess. The nano-cell component exists to filter out said heavy metals and compact them into usable growths that can be harvested for future use, while the biomatter can be used for fuel and to provide biomass for the Cloning Gardens. With the invention of the Weevil chassis, both Hivebuilder and Hiveworker alike have adopted these machines for use in harvesting, processing, and seeding Ambrosia stockpiles, which are essential for allowing a new colony to take root. The trading of Ambrosia strains between Rubbleborn and settlements such as Oasis have proven to be vital in ensuring some measure of goodwill between the recently-contacted posthumans and the overworlders.

actions.name: Sow The Seeds
actions.detail: One willing character of your choice within sensors becomes the host of quick-growth Ambrosian spores. You may attempt to plant the spores on an unwilling character by making a tech attack, infecting the target with the spores on a hit. The spores mature and bloom into Ambrosia at the start of your next turn, when this happens, you can choose to cause the target to become Slowed until the spores are cleared. A character can clear the spores with a successful Engineering check made as a Quick Action.

actions.name: Spore Burst
actions.detail: Choose one character within sensors that is hosting Mature Ambrosian Spores. The mature spores are released as a Burst 2 cloud of airborne spores, allowing you to target any character within the affected area with Sow The Seeds as a free action.

actions.name: Reap The Fruit
actions.detail: Choose one character hosting Mature Ambrosian Spores. If the target is allied, they regain HP equal to 1d3 + your GRIT and gain Soft Cover until the end of their next turn. If the target is hostile, they must succeed on an Engineering Save or become Jammed and Impaired until the end of their next turn. A character can become Jammed by this tech action only 1/scene. When a character is targeted by this tech action, any Ambrosian Spores being hosted by them wither away as their life cycle is complete.

name: "Piggyback" Mag-Clamps
description: Originally designed by the Rubbleborn colony known as “The Heap” as cargo clamps to allow vehicles and mechs to carry additional supplies, the "Piggyback" Mag-Clamps were found to allow increased mobility by DOJ/HR teams sent on long-duration missions where it was essential for units to move as fast as possible. Union Directorate personnel in Camp Fireside would obtain the schematics in exchange for materials and bring the system up to GMS standard.

name: Hive Caretaker Upgrade
description: Recently hatched neoborns are extremely vulnerable, and as such, Caretaker Cadres have developed techniques to ensure that they are as safe as possible. One such system is a dispenser of nano-cells that link together to form a thin but flexible forcefield. Protector Cadres found it was also useful for defensive purposes, and KIE-OWD segments across the system have been found to trade instances of the system for necessary supplies.

tags.name: Bolster
tags.description:
This system adds additional effects which enhance the Bolster action. Whenever you Bolster an allied character, you may also choose one of the Bolster options available to you and apply it to that character.
Credits to Kai Tave for the concept of this game mechanic.

actions.name: Security
actions.detail: The target and any character of your choice adjacent to them gain 1 Overshield. While a character has this Overshield, they gain immunity to dangerous terrain and extreme weather or ambient effects (such as extreme cold, particulate storms, etc).

name: HiveMind Entity: “Focused Fire”
effect:
1/round, when you successfully hit a character, you may apply a “Focused Fire” mark on them until the start of your next turn. Whenever an allied character within Hivemind range makes an attack against a marked target, that target cannot benefit from the Invisible status or Soft Cover.
HiveMind Entities are not self-aware enough to enter a Cascade state. They are also unable to take control of a mech as a protocol.
description: The HiveMind allows for extremely efficient levels of coordination between members of a colony. That said, getting neoborns to understand that is often a task for only the most experienced Caretakers, and incentives are often utilized to help them learn. The resulting HiveMind Entity is included in many of KIE’s basic packages to allow new users- namely “baseline” humans- to understand the workings of the HiveMind.

tags.description: Prohibits an AI system from being recognized as a valid target for Cascading (HIDDEN TAG)

tags.name: HIVEMIND
tags.description: HiveMind systems utilize a local sensor network to provide increased efficiency and coordination. You can use an Allied character's sensors as your own when using a Hivemind system, as long as they are within your sensors, or if you are within their sensors. This property ceases to function while you are Jammed.

tags.name: AI
tags.description: A mech can only have one system with this tag installed at a time. Some AI systems grant the AI tag to the mech. A mech with the AI tag has an NHP or comp/con unit installed that can act onsomewhat autonomously. A pilot can choose to hand over the controls to their AI  or take control back as a protocol. Their mech gains its own set of actions and reactions when controlled by an AI, but the pilot can’t take actions or reactions with it until the start of their next turn. AIs can’t benefit from talents, and have a small chance of cascading when they take structure damage or stress damage.

name: HiveMind Entity: “Ancestral Celerity”
effect:
Gain the “Ancestral Celerity” Full Action.
HiveMind Entities are not self-aware enough to enter a Cascade state. They are also unable to take control of a mech as a protocol.
description: The HiveMind has its origins in ancient technologies used to retain memories and skills to pass down from generation to generation. While the Maker did not truly create the HiveMind- as shown from the pre-cataclysm legacy code that Hivespeaker Cadres have untangled in their efforts to better understand the construct- the network itself remains an integral pillar of Rubbleborn culture and mechanobiology, at least for those who do not fall under the label of Autons. This HiveMind Entity was specifically formed by the Rubble’s Hivespeaker Cadres to delve into the deep recesses of the system to see what could be learned.
